instructions: This is the on-device user interface for TiltBridge, which is firmware for an ESP32 allowing it to read the Bluetooth signals broadcast by a Tilt Hydrometer (a digital sensor which reads the fermentation progress of liquids like beer or wine), interpret them, and retransmit them to various endpoints/services on the Web. Use terminology appropriate for beer brewing and wine making.

glossary.Tilt Hydrometer: A digital hydrometer, used for measuring fermentation progress. The name of the device is the 'Tilt Hydrometer'.
glossary.Tilt: A single Tilt Hydrometer. 'Tilt' in this application never refers to the concept of slope.
glossary.TiltBridge: A device that reads the bluetooth signal emitted by a Tilt Hydrometer and relays it to a web service (such as Fermentrack) via WiFi
glossary.Gravity: specific gravity - the measure of sugar content in fermenting liquid. Measurement of gravity over time represents the fermentation progress of a liquid.
glossary.Google Sheets: Google's spreadsheet application. The name of the service is 'Google Sheets'
glossary.Brewer's Friend: A web service that allows recording fermentation progress. The name of the service is 'Brewer's Friend'
glossary.Brewfather: A web service that allows recording fermentation progress. The name of the service is 'Brewfather'
glossary.Brewstatus: A web service that allows recording fermentation progress. The name of the service is 'Brewstatus'
glossary.Grainfather: A web service that allows recording fermentation progress. The name of the service is 'Grainfather'
glossary.TaplistIO: A web service that allows recording fermentation progress. The name of the service is 'TaplistIO'
glossary.Fermentrack: Legacy Fermentrack is a locally-hosted web service that allows recording fermentation progress. The name of the service is 'Fermentrack', but may be referred to as 'legacy Fermentrack' to differentiate it from Fermentrack 2
glossary.Fermentrack 2: The new, modern version of Fermentrack. The name of the service is 'Fermentrack', but it is almost always referred to as 'Fermentrack 2' to differentiate it from legacy Fermentrack.
glossary.Fermentrack.net: A cloud-hosted instance of Fermentrack 2, allowing a user to use Fermentrack 2 without installing it him/herself. Fermentrack.net is provided as a standalone service, and is a specific instance of Fermentrack 2
glossary.HomeBrewTalk: A forum dedicated to discussions of homebrewing
